      • look

        protected final java.lang.String look(int direction,
                                      boolean steps)
        Will determine if a critter is in the specified grid-spot based on the direction and distance.
        Parameters:
        direction - is a number 0-7 that corresponds to E, NE, N etc..
        steps - is equivalent to distance. False = 1 step, True = 2 steps
        Returns:
        null if empty, occupying Critter's toString if occupied

      • walk

        Parameters:

        Method to have Critter run.
        Parameters:
        direction - is the direction to move the critter in the world.

      • moveConditionals

        private void moveConditionals(int direction,
                              int distance,
                              int energyCost)
        Walk/run method for a Critter. Will call move(Critter, int, int) to move the Critter one/two spaces. Conditionals to check to see if the Critter:
        • If the Critter is a fighter and has not moved (thus they can move)
        • If the Critter is a fighter and HAS moved (can't move and get deducted for trying)
        • If the Critter is a fighter and has not moved, but tries to move into an occupied position
        Parameters:
        direction - is the direction to move in

      • move

        private static void move(Critter critter,
                         int direction,
                         int distance)
        Moves the critter in the specified direction with specified distance. Critter can move in 8 different directions with 0 being E, 1 = NE, 2 = N, 3 = NW, 4 = W, 5 = SW, 6 = S, 7 = SE.
        Parameters:
        critter - is the Critter to move
        direction - is the direction to move the critter
        distance - the distance to move the critter ( 1 for walk, 2 for run)

      • reproduce

        protected final void reproduce(Critter offspring,
                               int direction)
        New Critter offspring is given an x and y coordinate based on the direction passed and can be placed on top of another pre-existing critter. Added to babies list which will be added to population after worldTimeStep()
        Parameters:
        offspring - is the new offspring with attributes based off the parent. Child will have 1/2 of parent's energy rounded down. Parent will have its energy reduced by 1/2 rounded up.
        direction - is the direction to place the child Critter

      • doTimeStep

        public abstract void doTimeStep()
        Overriden by subclass. Method defines how creature behaves in the world but not encounters

      • fight

        public abstract boolean fight(java.lang.String oponent)
        Overridedn by subclass
        Parameters:
        oponent - is the toString of an opposing Critter
        Returns:
        true if the Critters wants to fight, false if not

      • makeCritter

        public static void makeCritter(java.lang.String critter_class_name)
                        throws InvalidCritterException
        create and initialize a Critter subclass. critter_class_name must be the unqualified name of a concrete subclass of Critter, if not, an InvalidCritterException must be thrown. (Java weirdness: Exception throwing does not work properly if the parameter has lower-case instead of upper. For example, if craig is supplied instead of Craig, an error is thrown instead of an Exception.)
        Parameters:
        critter_class_name - is the simple class name for a Critter.
        Throws:
        InvalidCritterException - if the class doesn't exist an other errors

      • getInstances

        public static java.util.List<Critter> getInstances(java.lang.String critter_class_name)
                                            throws InvalidCritterException
        Gets a list of critters of a specific type.
        Parameters:
        critter_class_name - What kind of Critter is to be listed. Unqualified class name.
        Returns:
        List of Critters.
        Throws:
        InvalidCritterException - if simple name doesn't match a defined class

      • runStats

        public static java.lang.String runStats(java.util.List<Critter> critters)
        Prints out how many Critters of each type there are on the board.
        Parameters:
        critters - List of Critters.

      • clearWorld

        public static void clearWorld()
        Clear the world of all critters, dead and alive

      • worldTimeStep

        public static void worldTimeStep()
        Handles all of the logic of a Critter interacting with its environment. Flow is:
        • Calling doTimeStep() on every Critter in population
        • Removing creatures that died after doTimeStep()
        • Searching through the grid to check if any Critters occupy the same site. The Critters in this spot will then fight until only one (or none) Critter remains
        • Adding the reproduced babies to the population
        • Adding more Algae
          • critters based on Params
        • Reducing all the Critters in population's energy for resting
        • Culling any Critters whose energy fell below zero

      • battle

        private static Critter battle(Critter A,
                              Critter B)
        Battle between two Critters. Critters that do not want to fight can try to run away if they have not moved yet. If a Critter tries to run away and fails, it will fight the opposing Critter with a roll of 0. If any of the Critters decide to fight, then they roll a number between 0 - (Critter.energy-1). Whichever Critter has the higher roll will be rewarded with 1/2 of the opposing Critter's energy rounded down, and the loser will be removed from the simulation. If both Critters roll the same number, or both 0, then the winner will be chosen randomly.
        Parameters:
        A - is a Critter that will be fighting
        B - is a Critter that will be fighting
        Returns:
        a Critter that has lost and needs to be removed, or null if a Critter either died for trying to run away or successfully ran away

      • removeDead

        private static boolean removeDead()
        Searches through the population to see if any of the Critter's energy fell below zero.
        Returns:
        a true if a Critter died, false if not.

      • displayWorld

        public static void displayWorld(java.lang.Object grid)
        Method for filling in the grid (GridPane) of the JavaFX GUI. The contents of world is looped through and the Critter (or no Critter) that exists at each x, y position is placed into the grid based upon the Critter's view characteristics
        Parameters:
        grid - is the grid to place the graphical representations of the critters

      • getShape

        private static javafx.scene.shape.Shape getShape(Critter critter)
        Helper method to bridge the Critter.CritterShape value and the actual graphical representation. Depending on the Critter's view characteristics, a shape will be constructed and colored.
        Parameters:
        critter - is the critter to graphically represent
        Returns:
        is a Shape that will represent the critter

      • convertTo1D

        private static int convertTo1D(int x,
                               int y)
        Converts a 2D position to 1D
        Parameters:
        x - is the x-coordinate
        y - is the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        y*(world width) + x

        Parameters:
